column3: is four and a half miles long and about half a mile in width. It is quite a resort in summer for those who want to breathe the briny air of the ocean.Charles and Laura had long been promised a visit to this famous bathing-place
column4: and one warm day in June their father drove them down to the island; for there is a bridge connecting it with the main land.As they drove along the beach
column5: they saw the bathers in the water
column6: and Charles was very desirous of having a dip in the salt sea himself; but he had no bathing-dress
column7: and so he had to give it up.It is very pleasant on a fine day in summer to stand on the beach
column8: and watch the waves as they come foaming up. The children were much entertained at seeing a Newfoundland dog rush into the water after a stick which his master would throw far out.They will long remember their pleasant visit to Coney Island; but the next time they go
column9: they mean to take their bathing-dresses and have a swim.
